intro: Argentina vulgaris, commonly known as the common argentine plant, is a flowering species native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, yellow flowers with a prominent central stigma. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes or as a natural indicator of wetland ecosystems.
